CollectionCitations.Creator: Yuan, T.
CollectionCitations.Title: MODIS Aqua L2 chopped blocks
CollectionCitations.Publisher: Goddard Earth Sciences Data and Information Services Center (GES DISC)

PublicationReferences.Author: Yuan, T., Song, H., Wood, R., Mohrmann, J., Meyer, K., Oreopoulos, L., and Platnick, S
PublicationReferences.Title: Applying deep learning to NASA MODIS data to create a community record of marine low-cloud mesoscale morphology

Quality: The latitudes, longitudes, and low cloud flag of all chopped blocks (128 pixels x 128 pixels size) from the MODIS Aqua granule data (MYD021KM, MYD03, MYD06_L2). Only daytime granule data are included. Blocks with sensor zenith angle > 45 are excluded.

RelatedUrls.Description: Access the dataset landing page from the GES DISC website.
Use the Earthdata Search to find and retrieve data sets across multiple data centers.
Access the data via the OPeNDAP protocol.
How to read and plot the data.

Abstract:
MODIS Aqua L2 chopped blocks (CB) are part of our global MODIS Aqua data from the 2017 MEaSUREs project, A Comprehensive Data Record of Marine Low-level and Deep Convective Cloud Systems Using an Object-Oriented Approach.

These data are individual MODIS Aqua granules chopped into small blocks in shape (np_x, np_y), where np_x = 128 pixels and np_y = 128 pixels.  This file provides the geolocations of all the chopped blocks in the MODIS Aqua granule data. Only daytime granule data are included for the years 2003-2020 and blocks with sensor zenith angle > 45 degrees are excluded. The geolocations for each block consist of five latitude and longitude pairs for its four corners and center  with a low cloud flag that indicates whether the chopped block is or is not low cloud dominated.

The DOIs of the related datasets in this project are:
MYD_L2_MPLCT_001 DOI: 10.5067/8TDZURGRLN9I
MYD_L3_OFLCT_001 DOI: 10.5067/3FAIC739DQRH

Projects.LongName: Making Earth System Data Records for Use in Research Environments

UseConstraints.Description: The Earth Observing System Data and Information System (EOSDIS) data use policy for NASA data can be accessed at https://earthdata.nasa.gov/earth-observation-data/data-use-policy. For information on how to properly cite and acknowledge data from the NASA GES DISC, refer to https://disc.gsfc.nasa.gov/information/documents?title=data-policy.
